title: [K-12] Program Learning-Based Curriculum for Design Thinking Concept Acquisition

context.prior_knowledge: Fundamental problem-solving skills and elementary understanding of design processes
context.additional_context: Parallel implementation of step-by-step digital program learning materials using personal devices (BYOD) and real-world problem-solving projects

learning_goals: Learners can accurately explain the five stages of design thinking (empathize, define, ideate, prototype, test).
Learners can propose structured solutions to given real-life problems following the design thinking process.
Learners autonomously acquire design thinking concepts through digital program learning materials and are evaluated on their application skills.

In teams of four, learners select one school/community issue (e.g., waste sorting efficiency, commute route safety), apply the five-stage design thinking process (empathize-define-ideate-prototype-test) to develop solutions including mathematical modeling (e.g., statistical analysis, optimization calculations), present the solution, and pass peer evaluation (at least two of three peers rate as "excellent") and teacher evaluation (three or more of five rubric items rated as "superior").
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
